message.content:
We must “extract” from the long list every row whose “type” is “Interest Receivables” and then add up the “amount” fields. In our data no “Interest” row appears in the initial (opening‐balance) set so we assume that at the beginning the balance was zero. (This is similar to the sample result in which no interest had yet accumulated before any transactions.) Then we add up the “Interest Receivables” entries from the transaction records.

Step 1. List (with the “amount” values) all the rows having type “Interest Receivables” (the “id” field starts with “Interest” in our file):
 • Interest20240101001    amount =  1201.5
 • Interest20240102002    amount =  1078.13164875
 • Interest20240103003    amount =  935.73164875
 • Interest20240104004    amount =  935.73164875
 • Interest20240105005    amount =  935.73164875
 • Interest20240106006    amount =  935.73164875
 • Interest20240107007    amount =  935.73164875
 • Interest20240108008    amount =  935.73164875
 • Interest20240109009    amount =  846.73164875
 • Interest20240110010    amount =  846.73164875
 • Interest20240111011    amount =  846.73164875
 • Interest20240112012    amount =  846.73164875
 • Interest20240113013    amount =  704.33164875
 • Interest20240114014    amount =  704.33164875
 • Interest20240115015    amount =  615.33164875
 • Interest20240116016    amount =  615.33164875

 • Interest20240118018    amount =  615.33164875
 • Interest20240119019    amount =  615.33164875
 • Interest20240120020    amount =  615.33164875
 • Interest20240121021    amount =  615.33164875
 • Interest20240122022    amount =  615.33164875
 • Interest20240123023    amount =  615.33164875
 • Interest20240124024    amount =  615.33164875
 • Interest20240125025    amount =  570.83164875
 • Interest20240126026    amount =  570.83164875
 • Interest20240127027    amount =  570.83164875
 • Interest20240128028    amount =  570.83164875
 • Interest20240129029    amount =  437.33164875
 • Interest20240130030    amount =  437.33164875
 • Interest20240131031    amount =  437.33164875
 • Interest20240201032    amount =  229.08465788            (≈229.08466)
 • Interest20240202033    amount =  229.08465788
 • Interest20240203034    amount =  229.08465788
 • Interest20240204035    amount =  229.08465788
 • Interest20240205036    amount =  229.08465788

Step 2. Sum the amounts. (One may add them step‐by‐step; here a running total obtains:)

• Sum of the first four rows:
  1201.5 + 1078.13164875 = 2279.63164875  
  2279.63164875 + 935.73164875 = 3215.3632975  
  3215.3632975 + 935.73164875 = 4151.09494625

Then adding row‑by‑row the remaining items yields a total of approximately 23,583.67.

Step 3. Since there is no “Interest Receivables” opening entry on 2023‑12‑31, we take the initial Interest Receivables balance as 0.00. (All these receivables were recorded during the period.)

Therefore, the interest receivable “end value” is the sum of all the “Interest Receivables” entries, namely about 23,583.67.

So our answer is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Interest Receivable Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Interest Receivable End Value": "23583.67"
  }
}
